60/**
61 * \brief Returns the Lua metatable names of each entity type.
62 * \return The Lua metatable name of each entity types.
63 */
64const std::map<EntityType, std::string>& get_entity_internal_type_names() {
65
66 static std::map<EntityType, std::string> result;
67 if (result.empty()) {
68 for (const auto& kvp : EnumInfoTraits<EntityType>::names) {
69 std::string internal_type_name = std::string("sol.") + kvp.second;
70 result.emplace(kvp.first, internal_type_name);
71 }
72 }
73
74 return result;
75}
76/**
77 * \brief Returns a set of the Lua metatable names of all entity types.
78 * \return The Lua metatable name of all entity types.
79 */
80const std::set<std::string>& get_entity_internal_type_names_set() {
81
82 static std::set<std::string> result;
83 if (result.empty()) {
84 for (const auto& kvp : EnumInfoTraits<EntityType>::names) {
85 result.insert(LuaContext::get_entity_internal_type_name(kvp.first));
86 }
87 }
88
89 return result;
90}
91
92}
93

546 register_type(get_entity_internal_type_name(EntityType::EXPLOSION), nullptr, entity_common_methods, metamethods);
547 register_type(get_entity_internal_type_name(EntityType::FIRE), nullptr, entity_common_methods, metamethods);
548 register_type(get_entity_internal_type_name(EntityType::ARROW), nullptr, entity_common_methods, metamethods);
549 register_type(get_entity_internal_type_name(EntityType::HOOKSHOT), nullptr, entity_common_methods, metamethods);
550 register_type(get_entity_internal_type_name(EntityType::BOOMERANG), nullptr, entity_common_methods, metamethods);
551}
552
553/**
554 * \brief Returns whether a value is a userdata of type entity.
555 * \param l A Lua context.
556 * \param index An index in the stack.
557 * \return true if the value at this index is a entity.
558 */
559bool LuaContext::is_entity(lua_State* l, int index) {
560
561 // We could return is_hero() || is_tile() || is_dynamic_tile() || ...
562 // but this would be tedious, costly and error prone.
563
564 void* udata = lua_touserdata(l, index);
565 if (udata == nullptr) {
566 // This is not a userdata.
567 return false;
568 }
569
570 if (!lua_getmetatable(l, index)) {
571 // The userdata has no metatable.
572 return false;
573 }
574
575 // Get the name of the Solarus type from this userdata.
576 lua_pushstring(l, "__solarus_type");
577 lua_rawget(l, -2);
578 if (!lua_isstring(l, -1)) {
579 // This is probably a userdata from some library other than Solarus.
580 lua_pop(l, 2);
581 return false;
582 }
583
584 // Check if the type name is one of the entity type names.
585 const std::string& type_name = lua_tostring(l, -1);
586 lua_pop(l, 2);
587
588 return get_entity_internal_type_names_set().find(type_name) != get_entity_internal_type_names_set().end();
589}
590
591/**
592 * \brief Checks that the userdata at the specified index of the stack is an
593 * entity and returns it.
594 * \param l A Lua context.
595 * \param index An index in the stack.
596 * \return The entity.
597 */
598EntityPtr LuaContext::check_entity(lua_State* l, int index) {
599
600 if (is_entity(l, index)) {
601 const ExportableToLuaPtr& userdata = *(static_cast<ExportableToLuaPtr*>(
602 lua_touserdata(l, index)
603 ));
604 return std::static_pointer_cast<Entity>(userdata);
605 }
606 else {
607 LuaTools::type_error(l, index, "entity");
608 throw;
609 }
610}
611
612/**
613 * \brief Pushes an entity userdata onto the stack.
614 *
615 * If the entity or its map does not exist anymore, pushes nil.
616 *
617 * \param l A Lua context.
618 * \param entity An entity.
619 */
620void LuaContext::push_entity(lua_State* l, Entity& entity) {
621
622 push_userdata(l, entity);
623}
624
625/**
626 * \brief Pushes a list of entities as an iterator onto the stack.
627 *
628 * The iterator is pushed onto the stack as one value of type function.
629 *
630 * \param l A Lua context.
631 * \param entity A list of entities. The iterator preserves their order.
632 */
633void LuaContext::push_entity_iterator(lua_State* l, const EntityVector& entities) {
634
635 // Create a Lua table with the list of entities, preserving their order.
636 int i = 0;
637 lua_newtable(l);
638 for (const EntityPtr& entity: entities) {
639 ++i;
640 lua_pushinteger(l, i);
641 push_entity(l, *entity);
642 lua_rawset(l, -3);
643 }
644
645 lua_pushinteger(l, entities.size());
646 lua_pushinteger(l, 1);
647 // 3 upvalues: entities table, size, current index.
648
649 lua_pushcclosure(l, l_entity_iterator_next, 3);
650}
651
652/**
653 * \brief Returns the Lua metatable name corresponding to a type of map entity.
654 * \param entity_type A type of map entity.
655 * \return The corresponding Lua metatable name, e.g. "sol.enemy".
656 */
657const std::string& LuaContext::get_entity_internal_type_name(
658 EntityType entity_type) {
659
660 const std::map<EntityType, std::string>& names = get_entity_internal_type_names();
661 const auto& it = names.find(entity_type);
662 SOLARUS_ASSERT(it != names.end(), "Missing entity internal type name");
663
664 return it->second;
665}
666
667/**
668 * \brief Closure of an iterator over a list of sprites and their names.
669 *
670 * This closure expects 3 upvalues in this order:
671 * - An array of { name, sprite } pairs.
672 * - The size of the array (for performance).
673 * - The current index in the array.
674 *
675 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
676 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
677 */
678int LuaContext::l_named_sprite_iterator_next(lua_State* l) {
679
680 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
681
682 // Get upvalues.
683 const int table_index = lua_upvalueindex(1);
684 const int size = lua_tointeger(l, lua_upvalueindex(2));
685 int index = lua_tointeger(l, lua_upvalueindex(3));
686
687 if (index > size) {
688 // Finished.
689 return 0;
690 }
691
692 // Get the next value.
693 lua_rawgeti(l, table_index, index); // pair
694 lua_rawgeti(l, -1, 1); // pair name
695 lua_rawgeti(l, -2, 2); // pair name sprite
696
697 // Increment index.
698 ++index;
699 lua_pushinteger(l, index);
700 lua_replace(l, lua_upvalueindex(3));
701
702 return 2;
703 });
704}
705
706/**
707 * \brief Pushes a list of sprites and their names as an iterator onto the stack.
708 *
709 * The iterator is pushed onto the stack as one value of type function.
710 *
711 * \param l A Lua context.
712 * \param sprites A list of sprites and their names. The iterator preserves their order.
713 */
714void LuaContext::push_named_sprite_iterator(
715 lua_State* l,
716 const std::vector<Entity::NamedSprite>& sprites
717) {
718 // Create a Lua table with the list of name-sprite pairs, preserving their order.
719 int i = 0;
720 lua_newtable(l);
721 // sprites
722 for (const Entity::NamedSprite& named_sprite: sprites) {
723 if (named_sprite.removed) {
724 continue;
725 }
726 ++i;
727 lua_newtable(l); // sprites pair
728 push_string(l, named_sprite.name); // sprites pair name
729 lua_rawseti(l, -2, 1); // sprites pair
730 push_sprite(l, *named_sprite.sprite); // sprites pair sprite
731 lua_rawseti(l, -2, 2); // sprites pair
732
733 lua_rawseti(l, -2, i); // sprites
734 }
735
736 lua_pushinteger(l, i);
737 lua_pushinteger(l, 1);
738 // 3 upvalues: sprites table, size, current index.
739
740 lua_pushcclosure(l, l_named_sprite_iterator_next, 3);
741}

889/**
890 * \brief Implementation of entity:set_size().
891 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
892 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
893 */
894int LuaContext::entity_api_set_size(lua_State* l) {
895
896 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
897 Entity& entity = *check_entity(l, 1);
898 int width = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
899 int height = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
900
901 if (width < 0 || width % 8 != 0) {
902 std::ostringstream oss;
903 oss << "Invalid width: " << width << ": should be a positive multiple of 8";
904 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2, oss.str());
905 }
906 if (height < 0 || height % 8 != 0) {
907 std::ostringstream oss;
908 oss << "Invalid height: " << height << ": should be a positive multiple of 8";
909 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 3, oss.str());
910 }
911
912 entity.set_size(width, height);
913 entity.notify_position_changed();
914
915 return 0;
916 });
917}

1159/**
1160 * \brief Implementation of entity:overlaps().
1161 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1162 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1163 */
1164int LuaContext::entity_api_overlaps(lua_State* l) {
1165
1166 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1167 Entity& entity = *check_entity(l, 1);
1168
1169 bool overlaps = false;
1170 if (is_entity(l, 2)) {
1171 Entity& other_entity = *check_entity(l, 2);
1172 std::string collision_mode_name = LuaTools::opt_string(l, 3, "overlapping");
1173
1174 CollisionMode collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_NONE;
1175 if (collision_mode_name == "overlapping") {
1176 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_OVERLAPPING;
1177 }
1178 else if (collision_mode_name == "containing") {
1179 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_CONTAINING;
1180 }
1181 else if (collision_mode_name == "origin") {
1182 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_ORIGIN;
1183 }
1184 else if (collision_mode_name == "facing") {
1185 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_FACING;
1186 }
1187 else if (collision_mode_name == "touching") {
1188 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_TOUCHING;
1189 }
1190 else if (collision_mode_name == "center") {
1191 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_CENTER;
1192 }
1193 else if (collision_mode_name == "sprite") {
1194 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_SPRITE;
1195 }
1196 else {
1197 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 3,
1198 std::string("Invalid name '") + lua_tostring(l, 2) + "'"
1199 );
1200 }
1201
1202 overlaps = entity.test_collision(other_entity, collision_mode);
1203 }
1204 else {
1205 int x = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
1206 int y = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
1207 int width = LuaTools::opt_int(l, 4, 1);
1208 int height = LuaTools::opt_int(l, 5, 1);
1209 overlaps = entity.overlaps(Rectangle(x, y, width, height));
1210 }
1211
1212 lua_pushboolean(l, overlaps);
1213 return 1;
1214 });
1215}

1233/**
1234 * \brief Implementation of entity:get_distance().
1235 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1236 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1237 */
1238int LuaContext::entity_api_get_distance(lua_State* l) {
1239
1240 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1241 const Entity& entity = *check_entity(l, 1);
1242 int distance;
1243 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 3) {
1244 int x = LuaTools::check_number(l, 2);
1245 int y = LuaTools::check_number(l, 3);
1246 distance = entity.get_distance(x, y);
1247 }
1248 else {
1249 const Entity& other_entity = *check_entity(l, 2);
1250 distance = entity.get_distance(other_entity);
1251 }
1252
1253 lua_pushinteger(l, distance);
1254 return 1;
1255 });
1256}

1283/**
1284 * \brief Implementation of entity:get_direction4_to().
1285 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1286 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1287 */
1288int LuaContext::entity_api_get_direction4_to(lua_State* l) {
1289
1290 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1291 const Entity& entity = *check_entity(l, 1);
1292 double angle;
1293 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 3) {
1294 int x = LuaTools::check_number(l, 2);
1295 int y = LuaTools::check_number(l, 3);
1296 angle = entity.get_angle(x, y);
1297 }
1298 else {
1299 const Entity& other_entity = *check_entity(l, 2);
1300 angle = entity.get_angle(other_entity);
1301 }
1302
1303 // Convert from radians.
1304 int direction4 = (angle + Geometry::PI_OVER_4) / Geometry::PI_OVER_2;
1305
1306 // Normalize.
1307 direction4 = (direction4 + 4) % 4;
1308
1309 lua_pushnumber(l, direction4);
1310 return 1;
1311 });
1312}

1461 }
1462
1463 return 0;
1464 });

1631 layer, bounding_box, entity));
1632 return 1;
1633 });

1738 * \brief Implementation of hero:teleport().
1739 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1740 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1741 */
1742int LuaContext::hero_api_teleport(lua_State* l) {
1743
1744 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1745 Hero& hero = *check_hero(l, 1);
1746 const std::string& map_id = LuaTools::check_string(l, 2);
1747 const std::string& destination_name = LuaTools::opt_string(l, 3, "");
1748 Transition::Style transition_style = LuaTools::opt_enum<Transition::Style>(
1749 l, 4, Transition::Style::FADE);
1750
1751 if (!CurrentQuest::resource_exists(ResourceType::MAP, map_id)) {
1752 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2, std::string("No such map: '") + map_id + "'");
1753 }
1754
1755 hero.get_game().set_current_map(map_id, destination_name, transition_style);
1756
1757 return 0;
1758 });
1759}

1825/**
1826 * \brief Implementation of hero:save_solid_ground().
1827 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1828 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1829 */
1830int LuaContext::hero_api_save_solid_ground(lua_State* l) {
1831
1832 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1833 Hero& hero = *check_hero(l, 1);
1834
1835 ScopedLuaRef callback;
1836 if (lua_gettop(l) == 2) {
1837 // Function parameter.
1838 if (lua_isnil(l, 2)) {
1839 hero.reset_target_solid_ground_callback();
1840 return 0;
1841 }
1842 else {
1843 callback = LuaTools::check_function(l, 2);
1844 }
1845 }
1846 else {
1847 // Coordinates and layer.
1848 int x = 0;
1849 int y = 0;
1850 int layer = 0;
1851 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 2) {
1852 x = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
1853 y = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
1854 layer = LuaTools::check_layer(l, 4, hero.get_map());
1855 }
1856 else {
1857 x = hero.get_x();
1858 y = hero.get_y();
1859 layer = hero.get_layer();
1860 }
1861 callback = hero.make_solid_ground_callback(Point(x, y), layer);
1862 }
1863 hero.set_target_solid_ground_callback(callback);
1864
1865 return 0;
1866 });
1867}
1868
1869/**
1870 * \brief Implementation of hero:reset_solid_ground().
1871 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1872 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1873 */
1874int LuaContext::hero_api_reset_solid_ground(lua_State* l) {
1875
1876 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1877 Hero& hero = *check_hero(l, 1);
1878
1879 hero.reset_target_solid_ground_callback();
1880
1881 return 0;
1882 });
1883}
1884
1885/**
1886 * \brief Implementation of hero:get_solid_ground().
1887 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1888 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1889 */
1890int LuaContext::hero_api_get_solid_ground_position(lua_State* l) {
1891
1892 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
1893 const Hero& hero = *check_hero(l, 1);
1894
1895 Point xy;
1896 int layer = 0;
1897
1898 const ScopedLuaRef& solid_ground_callback = hero.get_target_solid_ground_callback();
1899 if (!solid_ground_callback.is_empty()) {
1900 // Coordinates memorized by hero:save_solid_ground().
1901 solid_ground_callback.push();
1902 bool success = LuaTools::call_function(l, 0, 3, "Solid ground callback");
1903 if (!success) {
1904 // Fallback: use the last solid ground position.
1905 xy = hero.get_last_solid_ground_coords();
1906 layer = hero.get_last_solid_ground_layer();
1907 lua_pushinteger(l, xy.x);
1908 lua_pushinteger(l, xy.y);
1909 lua_pushinteger(l, layer);
1910 return 3;
1911 }
1912 else {
1913 // Normal case: use the result of the function.
1914 return 3;
1915 }
1916 }
1917 else if (hero.get_last_solid_ground_coords().x != -1) {
1918 xy = hero.get_last_solid_ground_coords();
1919 layer = hero.get_last_solid_ground_layer();
1920 // Last solid ground coordinates.
1921 lua_pushinteger(l, xy.x);
1922 lua_pushinteger(l, xy.y);
1923 lua_pushinteger(l, layer);
1924 return 3;
1925 }
1926 else {
1927 // No solid ground coordinates.
1928 // Maybe the map started in water.
1929 lua_pushnil(l);
1930 return 1;
1931 }
1932 });
1933}
1934
1935/**
1936 * \brief Implementation of hero:get_animation().
1937 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
1938 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
1939 */

2297/**
2298 * \brief Implementation of hero:start_treasure().
2299 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
2300 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
2301 */
2302int LuaContext::hero_api_start_treasure(lua_State* l) {
2303
2304 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
2305 Hero& hero = *check_hero(l, 1);
2306 const std::string& item_name = LuaTools::check_string(l, 2);
2307 int variant = LuaTools::opt_int(l, 3, 1);
2308 const std::string& savegame_variable = LuaTools::opt_string(l, 4, "");
2309
2310 if (!savegame_variable.empty()
2311 && !LuaTools::is_valid_lua_identifier(savegame_variable)) {
2312 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 4, std::string(
2313 "savegame variable identifier expected, got '") +
2314 savegame_variable + "'");
2315 }
2316
2317 if (!hero.get_game().get_equipment().item_exists(item_name)) {
2318 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2, std::string("No such item: '") + item_name + "'");
2319 }
2320
2321 Treasure treasure(hero.get_game(), item_name, variant, savegame_variable);
2322 if (treasure.is_found()) {
2323 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 4, "This treasure is already found");
2324 }
2325 if (!treasure.is_obtainable()) {
2326 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 4, "This treasure is not obtainable");
2327 }
2328
2329 const ScopedLuaRef& callback_ref = LuaTools::opt_function(l, 5);
2330
2331 hero.start_treasure(treasure, callback_ref);
2332
2333 return 0;
2334 });
2335}

2423/**
2424 * \brief Implementation of hero:start_hurt().
2425 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
2426 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
2427 */
2428int LuaContext::hero_api_start_hurt(lua_State* l) {
2429
2430 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
2431 // There are three possible prototypes:
2432 // - hero:start_hurt(damage)
2433 // - hero:start_hurt(source_x, source_y, damage)
2434 // - hero:start_hurt(source_entity, [source_sprite], damage)
2435 Hero& hero = *check_hero(l, 1);
2436
2437 if (lua_gettop(l) <= 2) {
2438 // hero:start_hurt(damage)
2439 int damage = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
2440 hero.hurt(damage);
2441 }
2442 else if (lua_isnumber(l, 2)) {
2443 // hero:start_hurt(source_x, source_y, damage)
2444 int source_x = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
2445 int source_y = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
2446 int damage = LuaTools::check_int(l, 4);
2447 hero.hurt(Point(source_x, source_y), damage);
2448 }
2449 else {
2450 // hero:start_hurt(source_entity, [source_sprite], damage)
2451 Entity& source_entity = *check_entity(l, 2);
2452 SpritePtr source_sprite;
2453 int index = 3;
2454 if (is_sprite(l, 3)) {
2455 source_sprite = check_sprite(l, 3);
2456 index = 4;
2457 }
2458 int damage = LuaTools::check_int(l, index);
2459 hero.hurt(source_entity, source_sprite.get(), damage);
2460 }
2461
2462 return 0;
2463 });
2464}
2465
2466/**
2467 * \brief Notifies Lua that the hero is brandishing a treasure.
2468 *
2469 * Lua then manages the treasure's dialog if any.
2470 *
2471 * \param treasure The treasure being brandished.
2472 * \param callback_ref Lua ref to a function to call when the
2473 * treasure's dialog finishes (possibly an empty ref).
2474 */
2475void LuaContext::notify_hero_brandish_treasure(
2476 const Treasure& treasure,
2477 const ScopedLuaRef& callback_ref
2478) {
2479 // This is getting tricky. We will define our own dialog callback
2480 // that will do some work and call callback_ref.
2481 std::ostringstream oss;
2482 oss << "_treasure." << treasure.get_item_name() << "." << treasure.get_variant();
2483 const std::string& dialog_id = oss.str();
2484 Game& game = treasure.get_game();
2485
2486 push_item(l, treasure.get_item());
2487 lua_pushinteger(l, treasure.get_variant());
2488 push_string(l, treasure.get_savegame_variable());
2489 push_ref(l, callback_ref);
2490 lua_pushcclosure(l, l_treasure_brandish_finished, 4);
2491 const ScopedLuaRef& treasure_callback_ref = create_ref();
2492
2493 if (!CurrentQuest::dialog_exists(dialog_id)) {
2494 // No treasure dialog: keep brandishing the treasure for some delay
2495 // and then execute the callback.
2496 TimerPtr timer = std::make_shared<Timer>(3000);
2497 push_map(l, game.get_current_map());
2498 add_timer(timer, -1, treasure_callback_ref);
2499 lua_pop(l, 1);
2500 }
2501 else {
2502 // A treasure dialog exists. Show it and then execute the callback.
2503 game.start_dialog(dialog_id, ScopedLuaRef(), treasure_callback_ref);
2504 }
2505}
2506
2507/**
2508 * \brief Callback function executed after the animation of brandishing
2509 * a treasure.
2510 *
2511 * Upvalues: item, variant, savegame variable, callback/nil.
2512 *
2513 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
2514 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
2515 */
2516int LuaContext::l_treasure_brandish_finished(lua_State* l) {
2517
2518 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
2519 LuaContext& lua_context = get_lua_context(l);
2520
2521 // The treasure's dialog is over.
2522 EquipmentItem& item = *check_item(l, lua_upvalueindex(1));
2523 int treasure_variant = LuaTools::check_int(l, lua_upvalueindex(2));
2524 const std::string& treasure_savegame_variable =
2525 LuaTools::check_string(l, lua_upvalueindex(3));
2526 lua_pushvalue(l, lua_upvalueindex(4));
2527
2528 // Check upvalues. Any error here would be the fault of the C++ side
2529 // because the user cannot call this function.
2530 Debug::check_assertion(item.get_game() != nullptr,
2531 "Equipment item without game");
2532
2533 Debug::check_assertion(lua_isnil(l, -1) || lua_isfunction(l, -1),
2534 "Expected function or nil for treasure callback");
2535
2536 Game& game = *item.get_game();
2537 Hero& hero = *game.get_hero();
2538 const Treasure treasure(game, item.get_name(), treasure_variant, treasure_savegame_variable);
2539
2540 // Notify the Lua item and the Lua map.
2541 if (!lua_isnil(l, -1)) {
2542 // There is a user callback for this treasure.
2543 lua_context.call_function(0, 0, "treasure callback");
2544 }
2545 lua_context.item_on_obtained(item, treasure);
2546 lua_context.map_on_obtained_treasure(game.get_current_map(), treasure);
2547
2548 if (hero.is_brandishing_treasure()) {
2549 // The script may have changed the hero's state.
2550 // If not, stop the treasure state.
2551 hero.start_free();
2552 }
2553
2554 return 0;
2555 });
2556}

2568/**
2569 * \brief Checks that the userdata at the specified index of the stack is a

2572 * \param index An index in the stack.
2573 * \return The camera.
2574 */
2575std::shared_ptr<Camera> LuaContext::check_camera(lua_State* l, int index) {
2576 return std::static_pointer_cast<Camera>(check_userdata(
2577 l, index, get_entity_internal_type_name(EntityType::CAMERA)
2578 ));
2579}

2581/**

2586void LuaContext::push_camera(lua_State* l, Camera& camera) {

2590/**
2591 * \brief Implementation of camera:get_position_on_screen().
2592 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
2593 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
2594 */
2595int LuaContext::camera_api_get_position_on_screen(lua_State* l) {
2596
2597 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
2598 const Camera& camera = *check_camera(l, 1);
2599
2600 const Point& position_on_screen = camera.get_position_on_screen();

3101 // No treasure.
3102 lua_pushnil(l);

3104 }

3110 lua_pushnil(l);

3125

3127 Chest& chest = *check_chest(l, 1);
3128 std::string item_name;
3129 int variant = 1;
3130 std::string savegame_variable;
3131
3132 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 2 && !lua_isnil(l, 2)) {
3133 item_name = LuaTools::check_string(l, 2);
3134 }
3135 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 3 && !lua_isnil(l, 3)) {
3136 variant = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
3137 }
3138 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 4 && !lua_isnil(l, 4)) {
3139 savegame_variable = LuaTools::check_string(l, 4);
3140 }
3141
3142 if (!savegame_variable.empty()
3143 && !LuaTools::is_valid_lua_identifier(savegame_variable)) {
3144 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 4,
3145 std::string("savegame variable identifier expected, got '")
3146 + savegame_variable + "'");
3147 }
3148
3149 Treasure treasure(chest.get_game(), item_name, variant, savegame_variable);
3150 chest.set_treasure(treasure);
3151
3152 return 0;
3153 });

3279
3280 if (maximum_moves == 2) {
3281 // 2 means no maximum in the side C++ side (for now).
3282 lua_pushnil(l);
3283 }
3284 else {
3285 lua_pushinteger(l, maximum_moves);
3286 }
3287 return 1;
3288 });
3289}
3290
3291/**
3292 * \brief Implementation of block:set_maximum_moves().
3293 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
3294 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
3295 */
3296int LuaContext::block_api_set_maximum_moves(lua_State* l) {
3297
3298 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
3299 Block& block = *check_block(l, 1);
3300 if (lua_type(l, 2) != LUA_TNUMBER && lua_type(l, 2) != LUA_TNIL) {
3301 LuaTools::type_error(l, 2, "number or nil");
3302 }
3303
3304 if (lua_isnumber(l, 2)) {
3305 const int maximum_moves = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
3306 if (maximum_moves < 0 || maximum_moves > 1) {
3307 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2, "maximum_moves should be 0, 1 or nil");
3308 }
3309 block.set_maximum_moves(maximum_moves);
3310 }
3311 else if (lua_isnil(l, 2)) {
3312 // 2 means no maximum in C++.
3313 block.set_maximum_moves(2);
3314 }
3315
3316 return 0;
3317 });
3318}

3751/**
3752 * \brief Notifies Lua that the hero interacts with a shop treasure.
3753 *
3754 * Lua then manages the dialogs shown to the player.
3755 *
3756 * \param shop_treasure A shop treasure.
3757 */
3758void LuaContext::notify_shop_treasure_interaction(ShopTreasure& shop_treasure) {
3759
3760 push_shop_treasure(l, shop_treasure);
3761 lua_pushcclosure(l, l_shop_treasure_description_dialog_finished, 1);
3762 const ScopedLuaRef& callback_ref = create_ref();
3763
3764 shop_treasure.get_game().start_dialog(
3765 shop_treasure.get_dialog_id(),
3766 ScopedLuaRef(),
3767 callback_ref
3768 );
3769}
3770
3771/**
3772 * \brief Callback function executed after the description dialog of
3773 * a shop treasure.
3774 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
3775 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
3776 */
3777int LuaContext::l_shop_treasure_description_dialog_finished(lua_State* l) {
3778
3779 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
3780
3781 // The description message has just finished.
3782 // The shop treasure is the first upvalue.
3783 ShopTreasure& shop_treasure = *check_shop_treasure(l, lua_upvalueindex(1));
3784 Game& game = shop_treasure.get_game();
3785
3786 if (shop_treasure.is_being_removed()) {
3787 // The shop treasure was removed during the dialog.
3788 return 0;
3789 }
3790
3791 lua_pushinteger(l, shop_treasure.get_price());
3792 const ScopedLuaRef& price_ref = LuaTools::create_ref(l);
3793
3794 push_shop_treasure(l, shop_treasure);
3795 lua_pushcclosure(l, l_shop_treasure_question_dialog_finished, 1);
3796 ScopedLuaRef callback_ref = LuaTools::create_ref(l);
3797
3798 game.start_dialog("_shop.question", price_ref, callback_ref);
3799
3800 return 0;
3801 });
3802}
3803
3804/**
3805 * \brief Callback function executed after the question dialog of
3806 * a shop treasure.
3807 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
3808 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
3809 */
3810int LuaContext::l_shop_treasure_question_dialog_finished(lua_State* l) {
3811
3812 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
3813 LuaContext& lua_context = get_lua_context(l);
3814
3815 // The "do you want to buy?" question has just been displayed.
3816 // The shop treasure is the first upvalue.
3817 ShopTreasure& shop_treasure = *check_shop_treasure(l, lua_upvalueindex(1));
3818
3819 if (shop_treasure.is_being_removed()) {
3820 // The shop treasure was removed during the dialog.
3821 return 0;
3822 }
3823
3824 // The first parameter is the answer.
3825 bool wants_to_buy = lua_isboolean(l, 1) && lua_toboolean(l, 1);
3826
3827 Game& game = shop_treasure.get_game();
3828 if (wants_to_buy) {
3829
3830 // The player wants to buy the item.
3831 Equipment& equipment = game.get_equipment();
3832 const Treasure& treasure = shop_treasure.get_treasure();
3833 EquipmentItem& item = treasure.get_item();
3834
3835 if (!treasure.is_obtainable()) {
3836 // This treasure is not allowed.
3837 Sound::play("wrong");
3838 }
3839 else if (equipment.get_money() < shop_treasure.get_price()) {
3840 // Not enough money.
3841 Sound::play("wrong");
3842 game.start_dialog("_shop.not_enough_money", ScopedLuaRef(), ScopedLuaRef());
3843 }
3844 else if (item.has_amount() && item.get_amount() >= item.get_max_amount()) {
3845 // The player already has the maximum amount of this item.
3846 Sound::play("wrong");
3847 game.start_dialog("_shop.amount_full", ScopedLuaRef(), ScopedLuaRef());
3848 }
3849 else {
3850
3851 bool can_buy = lua_context.shop_treasure_on_buying(shop_treasure);
3852 if (can_buy) {
3853
3854 // Give the treasure.
3855 equipment.remove_money(shop_treasure.get_price());
3856
3857 game.get_hero()->start_treasure(treasure, ScopedLuaRef());
3858 if (treasure.is_saved()) {
3859 shop_treasure.remove_from_map();
3860 game.get_savegame().set_boolean(treasure.get_savegame_variable(), true);
3861 }
3862 lua_context.shop_treasure_on_bought(shop_treasure);
3863 }
3864 }
3865 }
3866 return 0;
3867 });
3868}
3869

3911
3912 EntityPtr followed_entity = pickable.get_entity_followed();
3913
3914 if (followed_entity != nullptr) {

3918 lua_pushnil(l);

3939/**
3940 * \brief Implementation of pickable:get_treasure().
3941 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
3942 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
3943 */
3944int LuaContext::pickable_api_get_treasure(lua_State* l) {
3945
3946 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
3947 const Pickable& pickable = *check_pickable(l, 1);
3948 const Treasure& treasure = pickable.get_treasure();
3949
3950 push_item(l, treasure.get_item());
3951 lua_pushinteger(l, treasure.get_variant());
3952 if (!treasure.is_saved()) {
3953 lua_pushnil(l);
3954 }
3955 else {
3956 push_string(l, treasure.get_savegame_variable());
3957 }
3958 return 3;
3959 });

3994/**
3995 * \brief Implementation of destructible:get_treasure().
3996 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
3997 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
3998 */
3999int LuaContext::destructible_api_get_treasure(lua_State* l) {
4000
4001 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
4002 const Destructible& destructible = *check_destructible(l, 1);
4003 const Treasure& treasure = destructible.get_treasure();
4004
4005 if (treasure.get_item_name().empty()) {
4006 // No treasure: return nil.
4007 lua_pushnil(l);
4008 return 1;
4009 }
4010
4011 push_string(l, treasure.get_item_name());
4012 lua_pushinteger(l, treasure.get_variant());
4013 if (!treasure.is_saved()) {
4014 lua_pushnil(l);
4015 }
4016 else {
4017 push_string(l, treasure.get_savegame_variable());
4018 }
4019 return 3;
4020 });
4021}
4022
4023/**
4024 * \brief Implementation of destructible:set_treasure().
4025 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
4026 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
4027 */
4028int LuaContext::destructible_api_set_treasure(lua_State* l) {
4029
4030 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
4031 Destructible& destructible = *check_destructible(l, 1);
4032 std::string item_name, savegame_variable;
4033 int variant = 1;
4034
4035 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 2 && !lua_isnil(l, 2)) {
4036 item_name = LuaTools::check_string(l, 2);
4037 }
4038 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 3 && !lua_isnil(l, 3)) {
4039 variant = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
4040 }
4041 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 4 && !lua_isnil(l, 4)) {
4042 savegame_variable = LuaTools::check_string(l, 4);
4043 }
4044
4045 if (!savegame_variable.empty()
4046 && !LuaTools::is_valid_lua_identifier(savegame_variable)) {
4047 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 4,
4048 std::string("savegame variable identifier expected, got '")
4049 + savegame_variable + "'");
4050 }
4051
4052 Treasure treasure(destructible.get_game(), item_name, variant, savegame_variable);
4053 destructible.set_treasure(treasure);
4054
4055 return 0;
4056 });
4057}
4058

4620 Enemy::HurtStyle hurt_style = LuaTools::check_enum<Enemy::HurtStyle>(

4700int LuaContext::enemy_api_get_attack_consequence(lua_State* l) {
4701
4702 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
4703 const Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
4704 EnemyAttack attack = LuaTools::check_enum<EnemyAttack>(l, 2, Enemy::attack_names);
4705

4707 if (reaction.type == EnemyReaction::ReactionType::HURT) {

4714 }

4716 });

4725
4726 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
4727 Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
4728 EnemyAttack attack = LuaTools::check_enum<EnemyAttack>(l, 2, Enemy::attack_names);
4729

4733 std::ostringstream oss;
4734 oss << "Invalid life points number for attack consequence: '"

4739 }
4740 else {
4741 EnemyReaction::ReactionType reaction = LuaTools::check_enum<EnemyReaction::ReactionType>(
4742 l, 3);
4743 enemy.set_attack_consequence(attack, reaction);
4744 }
4745
4746 return 0;
4747 });

4873/**
4874 * \brief Implementation of enemy:get_treasure().
4875 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
4876 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
4877 */
4878int LuaContext::enemy_api_get_treasure(lua_State* l) {
4879
4880 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
4881 const Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
4882 const Treasure& treasure = enemy.get_treasure();
4883
4884 if (treasure.get_item_name().empty()) {
4885 // No treasure: return nil.
4886 lua_pushnil(l);
4887 return 1;
4888 }
4889
4890 push_string(l, treasure.get_item_name());
4891 lua_pushinteger(l, treasure.get_variant());
4892 if (!treasure.is_saved()) {
4893 lua_pushnil(l);
4894 }
4895 else {
4896 push_string(l, treasure.get_savegame_variable());
4897 }
4898 return 3;
4899 });
4900}
4901
4902
4903/**
4904 * \brief Implementation of enemy:set_treasure().
4905 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
4906 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
4907 */
4908int LuaContext::enemy_api_set_treasure(lua_State* l) {
4909
4910 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
4911 Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
4912 std::string item_name, savegame_variable;
4913 int variant = 1;
4914
4915 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 2 && !lua_isnil(l, 2)) {
4916 item_name = LuaTools::check_string(l, 2);
4917 }
4918 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 3 && !lua_isnil(l, 3)) {
4919 variant = LuaTools::check_int(l, 3);
4920 }
4921 if (lua_gettop(l) >= 4 && !lua_isnil(l, 4)) {
4922 savegame_variable = LuaTools::check_string(l, 4);
4923 }
4924
4925 if (!savegame_variable.empty()
4926 && !LuaTools::is_valid_lua_identifier(savegame_variable)) {
4927 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 4,
4928 std::string("savegame variable identifier expected, got '")
4929 + savegame_variable + "'");
4930 }
4931
4932 Treasure treasure(enemy.get_game(), item_name, variant, savegame_variable);
4933 enemy.set_treasure(treasure);
4934
4935 return 0;
4936 });
4937}

5023/**
5024 * \brief Implementation of enemy:hurt().
5025 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
5026 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
5027 */
5028int LuaContext::enemy_api_hurt(lua_State* l) {
5029
5030 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
5031 Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
5032 int life_points = LuaTools::check_int(l, 2);
5033
5034 if (enemy.is_in_normal_state() && !enemy.is_invulnerable()) {
5035 Hero& hero = enemy.get_map().get_entities().get_hero();
5036 enemy.set_attack_consequence(EnemyAttack::SCRIPT, EnemyReaction::ReactionType::HURT, life_points);
5037 enemy.try_hurt(EnemyAttack::SCRIPT, hero, nullptr);
5038 }

5040 return 0;
5041 });

5044/**
5045 * \brief Implementation of enemy:immobilize().
5046 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
5047 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
5048 */
5049int LuaContext::enemy_api_immobilize(lua_State* l) {
5050
5051 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
5052 Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
5053
5054 if (enemy.is_invulnerable()) {
5055 return 0;
5056 }
5057
5058 if (enemy.is_in_normal_state() || enemy.is_immobilized()) {
5059 Hero& hero = enemy.get_map().get_entities().get_hero();
5060 enemy.set_attack_consequence(EnemyAttack::SCRIPT, EnemyReaction::ReactionType::IMMOBILIZED, 0);
5061 enemy.try_hurt(EnemyAttack::SCRIPT, hero, nullptr);
5062 }
5063
5064 return 0;
5065 });
5066}
5067
5068/**
5069 * \brief Implementation of enemy:create_enemy().
5070 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
5071 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
5072 */
5073int LuaContext::enemy_api_create_enemy(lua_State* l) {
5074
5075 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
5076 Enemy& enemy = *check_enemy(l, 1);
5077 LuaTools::check_type(l, 2, LUA_TTABLE);
5078 const std::string& name = LuaTools::opt_string_field(l, 2, "name", "");
5079 int layer = LuaTools::opt_layer_field(l, 2, "layer", enemy.get_map(), enemy.get_layer());
5080 int x = LuaTools::opt_int_field(l, 2, "x", 0);
5081 int y = LuaTools::opt_int_field(l, 2, "y", 0);
5082 int direction = LuaTools::opt_int_field(l, 2, "direction", 3);
5083 const std::string& breed = LuaTools::check_string_field(l, 2, "breed");
5084 const std::string& savegame_variable = LuaTools::opt_string_field(l, 2, "savegame_variable", "");
5085 const std::string& treasure_name = LuaTools::opt_string_field(l, 2, "treasure_name", "");
5086 int treasure_variant = LuaTools::opt_int_field(l, 2, "treasure_variant", 1);
5087 const std::string& treasure_savegame_variable = LuaTools::opt_string_field(l, 2, "treasure_savegame_variable", "");
5088
5089 if (!savegame_variable.empty()
5090 && !LuaTools::is_valid_lua_identifier(savegame_variable)) {
5091 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2, std::string(
5092 "Bad field 'savegame_variable' (invalid savegame variable identifier '")
5093 + savegame_variable + "'");
5094 }
5095
5096 if (!treasure_savegame_variable.empty()
5097 && !LuaTools::is_valid_lua_identifier(treasure_savegame_variable)) {
5098 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2, std::string(
5099 "Bad field 'treasure_savegame_variable' (invalid savegame variable identifier '")
5100 + treasure_savegame_variable + "'");
5101 }
5102
5103 // Make x and y relative to the existing enemy.
5104 x += enemy.get_x();
5105 y += enemy.get_y();
5106
5107 // Create the new enemy.
5108 Map& map = enemy.get_map();
5109
5110 if (!map.is_loaded()) {
5111 LuaTools::error(l, "Cannot create enemy: this map is not running");
5112 }
5113
5114 Game& game = map.get_game();
5115 const EntityPtr& entity = Enemy::create(
5116 game,
5117 breed,
5118 savegame_variable,
5119 name,
5120 layer,
5121 { x, y },
5122 direction,
5123 Treasure(game, treasure_name, treasure_variant, treasure_savegame_variable)
5124 );
5125
5126 if (entity == nullptr) {
5127 // The enemy is saved as already dead.
5128 lua_pushnil(l);
5129 return 1;
5130 }
5131
5132 map.get_entities().add_entity(entity);
5133
5134 push_entity(l, *entity);
5135 return 1;
5136 });
5137}

5147}

5150 * \brief Checks that the userdata at the specified index of the stack is a

5154 * \return The custom entity.
5155 */
5156std::shared_ptr<CustomEntity> LuaContext::check_custom_entity(lua_State* l, int index) {

5171/**
5172 * \brief Calls the specified a Lua traversable test function.
5173 * \param traversable_test_ref Lua ref to a traversable test function.
5174 * \param custom_entity The custom entity that is testing if it can traverse
5175 * or be traversed by another entity.
5176 * \param other_entity The other entity.
5177 * \return \c true if the traversable test function returned \c true.
5178 */
5179bool LuaContext::do_custom_entity_traversable_test_function(
5180 const ScopedLuaRef& traversable_test_ref,
5181 CustomEntity& custom_entity,
5182 Entity& other_entity) {
5183
5184 Debug::check_assertion(!traversable_test_ref.is_empty(),
5185 "Missing traversable test function ref"
5186 );
5187
5188 // Call the test function.
5189 push_ref(l, traversable_test_ref);
5190 Debug::check_assertion(lua_isfunction(l, -1),
5191 "Traversable test is not a function"
5192 );
5193 push_custom_entity(l, custom_entity);
5194 push_entity(l, other_entity);
5195 if (!LuaTools::call_function(l, 2, 1, "traversable test function")) {
5196 // Error in the traversable test function.
5197 return false;
5198 }
5199
5200 // See its result.
5201 bool traversable = lua_toboolean(l, -1);
5202 lua_pop(l, 1);
5203
5204 return traversable;
5205}
5206
5207/**
5208 * \brief Calls the specified a Lua collision test function.
5209 * \param collision_test_ref Lua ref to a collision test function.
5210 * \param custom_entity The custom entity that is testing the collision.
5211 * \param other_entity The entity to test a collision with.
5212 * \return \c true if the collision test function returned \c true.
5213 */
5214bool LuaContext::do_custom_entity_collision_test_function(
5215 const ScopedLuaRef& collision_test_ref,
5216 CustomEntity& custom_entity,
5217 Entity& other_entity
5218) {
5219 Debug::check_assertion(!collision_test_ref.is_empty(),
5220 "Missing collision test function"
5221 );
5222
5223 // Call the test function.
5224 push_ref(l, collision_test_ref);
5225 Debug::check_assertion(lua_isfunction(l, -1),
5226 "Collision test is not a function"
5227 );
5228 push_custom_entity(l, custom_entity);
5229 push_entity(l, other_entity);
5230 if (!LuaTools::call_function(l, 2, 1, "collision test function")) {
5231 // Error in the collision test function.
5232 return false;
5233 }
5234
5235 // See its result.
5236 bool collision = lua_toboolean(l, -1);
5237 lua_pop(l, 1);
5238
5239 return collision;
5240}

5242/**
5243 * \brief Executes a callback after a custom entity detected a collision.
5244 * \param callback_ref Ref of the function to call.
5245 * \param custom_entity A custom entity that detected a collision.
5246 * \param other_entity The entity that was detected.
5247 */
5248void LuaContext::do_custom_entity_collision_callback(
5249 const ScopedLuaRef& callback_ref,
5250 CustomEntity& custom_entity,
5251 Entity& other_entity
5252) {
5253 Debug::check_assertion(!callback_ref.is_empty(),
5254 "Missing collision callback");
5255
5256 push_ref(l, callback_ref);
5257 Debug::check_assertion(lua_isfunction(l, -1),
5258 "Collision callback is not a function");
5259 push_custom_entity(l, custom_entity);
5260 push_entity(l, other_entity);
5261 LuaTools::call_function(l, 2, 0, "collision callback");
5262}
5263
5264/**
5265 * \brief Executes a callback after a custom entity detected a pixel-precise
5266 * collision.
5267 * \param callback_ref Ref of the function to call.
5268 * \param custom_entity A custom entity that detected a collision.
5269 * \param other_entity The entity that was detected.
5270 * \param custom_entity_sprite Sprite of the custom entity involved in the
5271 * collision.
5272 * \param other_entity_sprite Sprite of the detected entity involved in the
5273 * collision.
5274 */
5275void LuaContext::do_custom_entity_collision_callback(
5276 const ScopedLuaRef& callback_ref,
5277 CustomEntity& custom_entity,
5278 Entity& other_entity,
5279 Sprite& custom_entity_sprite,
5280 Sprite& other_entity_sprite) {
5281
5282 Debug::check_assertion(!callback_ref.is_empty(),
5283 "Missing sprite collision callback"
5284 );
5285
5286 push_ref(l, callback_ref);
5287 Debug::check_assertion(lua_isfunction(l, -1),
5288 "Sprite collision callback is not a function");
5289 push_custom_entity(l, custom_entity);
5290 push_entity(l, other_entity);
5291 push_sprite(l, custom_entity_sprite);
5292 push_sprite(l, other_entity_sprite);
5293 LuaTools::call_function(l, 4, 0, "collision callback");
5294}

5375/**
5376 * \brief Implementation of custom_entity:set_traversable_by().
5377 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
5378 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
5379 */
5380int LuaContext::custom_entity_api_set_traversable_by(lua_State* l) {
5381
5382 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
5383 CustomEntity& entity = *check_custom_entity(l, 1);
5384
5385 bool type_specific = false;
5386 EntityType type = EntityType::TILE;
5387 int index = 2;
5388 if (lua_isstring(l, index)) {
5389 ++index;
5390 type_specific = true;
5391 type = LuaTools::check_enum<EntityType>(
5392 l, 2
5393 );
5394 }
5395
5396 if (lua_isnil(l, index)) {
5397 // Reset the setting.
5398 if (!type_specific) {
5399 entity.reset_traversable_by_entities();
5400 }
5401 else {
5402 entity.reset_traversable_by_entities(type);
5403 }
5404 }
5405 else if (lua_isboolean(l, index)) {
5406 // Boolean value.
5407 bool traversable = lua_toboolean(l, index);
5408 if (!type_specific) {
5409 entity.set_traversable_by_entities(traversable);
5410 }
5411 else {
5412 entity.set_traversable_by_entities(type, traversable);
5413 }
5414 }
5415 else if (lua_isfunction(l, index)) {
5416 // Custom boolean function.
5417
5418 const ScopedLuaRef& traversable_test_ref = LuaTools::check_function(l, index);
5419 if (!type_specific) {
5420 entity.set_traversable_by_entities(traversable_test_ref);
5421 }
5422 else {
5423 entity.set_traversable_by_entities(type, traversable_test_ref);
5424 }
5425 }
5426 else {
5427 LuaTools::type_error(l, index, "boolean, function or nil");
5428 }
5429
5430 return 0;
5431 });
5432}
5433

5537/**
5538 * \brief Implementation of custom_entity:add_collision_test().
5539 * \param l The Lua context that is calling this function.
5540 * \return Number of values to return to Lua.
5541 */
5542int LuaContext::custom_entity_api_add_collision_test(lua_State* l) {
5543
5544 return LuaTools::exception_boundary_handle(l, [&] {
5545 CustomEntity& entity = *check_custom_entity(l, 1);
5546
5547 const ScopedLuaRef& callback_ref = LuaTools::check_function(l, 3);
5548
5549 if (lua_isstring(l, 2)) {
5550 // Built-in collision test.
5551 // TODO move string to enum conversion into a function of Entity.
5552 // We cannot use LuaTools::check_enum() like always, because this
5553 // enum has special numerical values.
5554 const std::string& collision_mode_name = LuaTools::check_string(l, 2);
5555 CollisionMode collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_NONE;
5556
5557 if (collision_mode_name == "overlapping") {
5558 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_OVERLAPPING;
5559 }
5560 else if (collision_mode_name == "containing") {
5561 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_CONTAINING;
5562 }
5563 else if (collision_mode_name == "origin") {
5564 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_CONTAINING;
5565 }
5566 else if (collision_mode_name == "facing") {
5567 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_FACING;
5568 }
5569 else if (collision_mode_name == "touching") {
5570 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_TOUCHING;
5571 }
5572 else if (collision_mode_name == "center") {
5573 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_CENTER;
5574 }
5575 else if (collision_mode_name == "sprite") {
5576 collision_mode = CollisionMode::COLLISION_SPRITE;
5577 }
5578 else {
5579 LuaTools::arg_error(l, 2,
5580 std::string("Invalid name '") + lua_tostring(l, 2) + "'"
5581 );
5582 }
5583
5584 entity.add_collision_test(collision_mode, callback_ref);
5585 }
5586 else if (lua_isfunction(l, 2)) {
5587 // Custom collision test.
5588 const ScopedLuaRef& collision_test_ref = LuaTools::check_function(l, 2);
5589 entity.add_collision_test(collision_test_ref, callback_ref);
5590 }
5591 else {
5592 LuaTools::type_error(l, 2, "string or function");
5593 }
5594
5595 return 0;
5596 });
5597}
5598

5637/**
5638 * \brief Implementation of custom_entity:set_modified_ground().

5641 */
5642int LuaContext::custom_entity_api_set_modified_ground(lua_State* l) {
5643

5645 CustomEntity& entity = *check_custom_entity(l, 1);
5646 Ground modified_ground = Ground::EMPTY;
5647
5648 if (lua_gettop(l) == 1) {
5649 LuaTools::type_error(l, 2, "string or nil");
5650 }
5651 if (!lua_isnil(l, 2)) {
5652 modified_ground = LuaTools::check_enum<Ground>(l, 2);
5653 }
5654
5655 entity.set_modified_ground(modified_ground);
5656 return 0;
5657 });
5658}

5662 *
5663 * Does nothing if the method is not defined.
5664 *
5665 * \param entity A map entity.
5666 */
5667void LuaContext::entity_on_update(Entity& entity) {
5668
5669 // This particular method is tried so often that we want to optimize
5670 // the std::string construction.
5671 static const std::string method_name = "on_update";
5672 if (!userdata_has_field(entity, method_name)) {
5673 return;
5674 }
5675
5676 push_entity(l, entity);
5677 on_update();
5678 lua_pop(l, 1);
5679}
